question: Although you have never formally studied computing, you have always been interested in computers. You have just read about a computer course that really interests you, but it is only for people who have completed an elementary course.Write a letter to the college enrolment officer. In your letterexplain why you are writingdescribe your circumstancesask if a special exception can be made for you so you can enrol in the courseYou do NOT need to write any addresses.Begin your letter as follows:Dear
text: I am writing this letter regarding the enrollment in the computer course that you are starting. Do you still have  space for one student?

I know that having basic knowledge is a requirement for your class. However, I want to make it clear that I had no computer-related course in my elementary school mainly due to work overload. But this does not mean that I am not interested in learning about computers. In fact, I always wished to have one such course.

Could you make an exception for me?I would be grateful if you give me an opportunity to do this subject. I can assure you that you will not regret  giving me a chance as I will put all my efforts to do it. Moreover, I am a fast learner and I grasp  things quickly. In spite of this, if you are doubtful about my performance, I can show you my academic grades.
I look forward to hearing from you.
